The OFT closed on 31 March 2014 and this website is no longer being updated. The OFT's work and responsibilities have passed to a number of different bodies. Read more.

Market investigation references

Under the Enterprise Act, we have the power to refer markets to the Competition Commission for further investigation where we have reasonable grounds for suspecting that any feature, or combination of features, of a market is preventing, restricting, or distorting competition.

Following a reference it will be for the Competition Commission to decide whether competition is indeed prevented, restricted or distorted, and (if so) what, if any, action should be taken to remedy the adverse effect on competition or any detrimental effect on consumers arising from the adverse effect.

The OFT has prepared a guidance booklet that provides information on the circumstances in which markets will be referred to the Competition Commission for investigation under the Enterprise Act.

Download Market investigation references - February 2006 (pdf 430 kb).

Download A summary of responses to the public consultation - February 2006 (pdf 105 kb).

Read our policy note Practice on consultation on proposed decisions in relation to market investigation references (OFT1308) (pdf 243kb).

Below is a list of Market Investigation References with dates of reference.


In this section
  • Aggregates 18 January 2012
  • BAA airports - 30 March 2007
  • Classified advertising services - 5 April 2005
  • Extended warranties - 2 July 2002
  • Groceries - 9 May 2006
  • Home credit - 20 December 2004
  • Local bus services - 7 January 2010
  • Northern Ireland banking - 26 May 2005
  • Payday lending - 27 June 2013
  • Payment Protection Insurance - 7 February 2007
  • Private healthcare
  • Statutory audit - 21 October 2011
  • Store cards - 18 March 2004
  • The supply of liquefied petroleum gas - 5 Jul 2004
